intro: Cephaelis cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas' celandine, is a flowering plant native to the Andes region of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of herbs, shrubs, and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
